meanings.definition: Vells (noun): plural form of vellum, a fine parchment made from the skin of a calf or lamb
meanings.sent1: The library had many ancient books bound in vells.
meanings.sent2: She carefully turned the pages of the vells to read the old text.
meanings.sent3: The artist used vells to create delicate drawings of animals.
meanings.sent4: The vells whispered stories of the past to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The vells felt smooth and luxurious to the touch.

meanings.definition: Vells (verb): third person singular present of vell, to remove the vellum from a book
meanings.sent1: He vells the pages with precision, preserving the delicate vellum.
meanings.sent2: The librarian vells the old manuscripts to protect them from damage.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally vells a page while trying to repair the book.
meanings.sent4: The vellum slowly vells away, revealing the secrets hidden within.
meanings.sent5: Care must be taken not to vells too roughly and tear the precious vellum.

meanings.definition: Vells (adjective): relating to or made of vellum
meanings.sent1: The vells cover of the book was beautifully embossed.
meanings.sent2: She admired the vells pages of the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The vells texture of the paper gave it a unique feel.
meanings.sent4: His words were written on vells paper, adding a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent5: The vells binding of the journal made it stand out on the shelf.
